content: The Act may be cited as the "Preserving Access to Cost Effective Drugs Act" or the "PACED Act". Abrogation of sovereign immunity is addressed in the Act. Title 35, United States Code, is amended to address sovereign immunity, stating that a patent owner cannot assert sovereign immunity as a defense in a derivation proceeding, except under certain circumstances. The amendment to Title 35, United States Code, addresses sovereign immunity in patent proceedings, stating that a foreign state patent owner cannot claim immunity in a Patent Trial and Appeal Board proceeding, subject to certain limitations under the 11th amendment. The amendment includes the abrogation of tribal sovereign immunity, defining covered claims related to patent infringement and the Public Health Service Act, and specifying the meaning of "Indian tribe" as per the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act. The Determination and Education Assistance Act addresses sovereign immunity in patent proceedings, prohibiting Indian tribes from asserting sovereign immunity as a defense in court actions.
